title: Death resistance
data:
**Death resistance** is an "informal" [property](/wiki/Property "Property") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, and protects against most magical sources of [instant death](/wiki/Instant_death "Instant death").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Description](#Description)

- [2 Variants](#Variants)

  - [2.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [2.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [2.3 FIQHack](#FIQHack)
  - [2.4 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [2.5 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)

- [3 References](#References)

## Description

Monsters with death resistance are immune to the instant death effect of the [touch of death](/wiki/Touch_of_death "Touch of death") [monster spell](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell"),rays from a [wand of death](/wiki/Wand_of_death "Wand of death") and rays from the [finger of death](/wiki/Finger_of_death "Finger of death") spell. This property does not have its own flag like other resistances, and is instead governed by various other sections of code tied to those attacks and spells.

If a monster is [nonliving](/wiki/Nonliving "Nonliving"), a [major demon](/wiki/Major_demon "Major demon"), a [vampire](/wiki/Vampire "Vampire") in one of their [shapeshifter](/wiki/Shapeshifter "Shapeshifter") forms, or has player-style [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance") (either from possessing a [magic missile](/wiki/Magic_missile "Magic missile") attack or an extrinsic source of magic resistance), they are unaffected by the above spells and attacks[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) - monsters will not actively use the touch of death or other monster spells against other monsters. [Death](/wiki/Death_\(monster\) "Death (monster)") is not special-cased to resist death magic in this manner, but will instead absorb it and empower itself.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

The [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero") resists death magic if they are [polymorphed](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") into a death-resistant monster;[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)[\[5\]](#cite_note-5) magic resistance will block the effects of the touch of death and death rays zapped at them, but will not block a death ray zapped directly at themselves.[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)[\[7\]](#cite_note-7)

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), death resistance is a "formal" property governed by the **`MR_DEATH`** flag in [monflag.h](/wiki/Monflag.h "Monflag.h") - this also applies to [SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM). A monster that has the death resistance property and is hit by a touch of death or a death ray will resist the instant death effects of those attacks, but will still take damage.

This property can be found on various monsters in the dungeon, including some of the more powerful ones. As in *NetHack*, the hero cannot obtain this specific property as an intrinsic from a corpse or through any external source, but can polymorph into a monster that has the property; death resistance will not protect the hero from a death ray zapped at themselves.

The following SLASH'EM monsters possess death resistance, and are listed in rough order of their appearance in [monst.c](/wiki/Monst.c "Monst.c"):

- g [Statue gargoyle](/wiki/Statue_gargoyle "Statue gargoyle")

- all [angelic beings](/wiki/Angelic_being "Angelic being") except the A [couatl](/wiki/Couatl "Couatl") and A [Aleax](/wiki/Aleax "Aleax")

- F [Shrieker](/wiki/Shrieker "Shrieker")

- H [Titan](/wiki/Titan "Titan")

- H [Minotaur](/wiki/Minotaur "Minotaur")

- P [Gray ooze](/wiki/Gray_ooze "Gray ooze")

- P [Brown pudding](/wiki/Brown_pudding "Brown pudding")

- P [Moldy pudding](/wiki/Moldy_pudding "Moldy pudding")

- P [Black pudding](/wiki/Black_pudding "Black pudding")

- ' [Rope golem](/wiki/Rope_golem "Rope golem")

- ' [Leather golem](/wiki/Leather_golem "Leather golem")

- ' [Wood golem](/wiki/Wood_golem "Wood golem")

- @ [Gypsy](/wiki/Gypsy "Gypsy")

- @ [Black marketeer](/wiki/Black_marketeer "Black marketeer")

- & [Spined devil](/wiki/Spined_devil "Spined devil")

- & [Bearded devil](/wiki/Bearded_devil "Bearded devil")

- & [bar-lgura](/wiki/Bar-lgura "Bar-lgura")

- & [chasme](/wiki/Chasme "Chasme")

- & [babau](/wiki/Babau "Babau")

- & [nabassu](/wiki/Nabassu "Nabassu")

- Some [quest nemeses](/wiki/Quest_nemeses "Quest nemeses"):

  - @ [Water Mage](/wiki/Water_Mage "Water Mage")
  - @ [Earth Mage](/wiki/Earth_Mage "Earth Mage")
  - & [Maugneshaagar](/wiki/Maugneshaagar "Maugneshaagar")

- [Defunct monsters](/wiki/Defunct_features_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Defunct features (SLASH'EM)"):

  - @ [Transmuter](/wiki/Transmuter "Transmuter")
  - @ [Lareth](/wiki/Lareth "Lareth")
  - @ [Sir Lorimar](/wiki/Sir_Lorimar "Sir Lorimar")

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"), and [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack"), the [spirit](/wiki/Spirits_\(dNetHack\) "Spirits (dNetHack)") [Ose](/wiki/Ose "Ose") grants a hero that binds her immunity to death effects, including from zapping a wand of death at themselves - the character's [steed](/wiki/Steed "Steed") can gain this immunity if they also have [Berith](/wiki/Berith "Berith") bound.

In addition to the same monsters as *NetHack*, various other monsters in dNetHack are made immune to death magic, and some are even empowered by it:

- [Metroids](/wiki/Metroid "Metroid"): metroid monsters that are hit by death magic will not die and instead [divide](/wiki/Divide "Divide") from absorbing the ray; if you zap a death ray at yourself while in the form of a metroid, you are healed for 3d10 [HP](/wiki/HP "HP").
- All [lawful angels](/index.php?title=Lawful_angels_and_minions_\(dNetHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Lawful angels and minions (dNetHack) (page does not exist)")
- All [neutral angels](/index.php?title=Neutral_angels_and_minions_\(dNetHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Neutral angels and minions (dNetHack) (page does not exist)")
- All [chaotic angels](/index.php?title=Chaotic_angels_and_minions_\(dNetHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Chaotic angels and minions (dNetHack) (page does not exist)")
- All [Keter Sephiroth](/wiki/Keter_Sephiroth "Keter Sephiroth")
- All [golems](/wiki/Golem "Golem") except the [ford guardian](/index.php?title=Ford_guardian\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Ford guardian (page does not exist)") and [grove guardian](/index.php?title=Grove_guardian\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Grove guardian (page does not exist)")

### FIQHack

In [FIQHack](/wiki/FIQHack "FIQHack"), death resistance is one of the properties that can be conferred by [quaffing](/wiki/Quaff "Quaff") or [dipping](/wiki/Dip "Dip") into a [potion of wonder](/wiki/Potion_of_wonder "Potion of wonder").

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), magic resistance still prevents the instadeath effects of death rays or death touches, but no longer offers complete protection against them: the target will still take significant damage and have their maximum HP drained. [Half spell damage](/wiki/Half_spell_damage "Half spell damage") combined with magic resistance can reduce this damage further. The [Gauntlets of Purity](/wiki/Gauntlets_of_Purity "Gauntlets of Purity") offer complete protection from death magic while worn.

In addition to the same monsters from *NetHack*, the following monsters in EvilHack are also immune to death magic:

- All [angelic beings](/wiki/Angelic_being "Angelic being")
- All [quest leaders](/wiki/Quest_leader "Quest leader")
- [Cerberus](/wiki/Cerberus_\(EvilHack\) "Cerberus (EvilHack)")
- [Baby](/index.php?title=Baby_celestial_dragon\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Baby celestial dragon (page does not exist)") and adult [celestial dragons](/index.php?title=Celestial_dragon\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Celestial dragon (page does not exist)")
- [Death](/wiki/Death_\(monster\) "Death (monster)")

### SlashTHEM

[SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") also features death resistance as a property, with the same effects as in SLASH'EM.

In addition to the listed [SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM) monsters, the following monsters introduced in SlashTHEM have death resistance:

- A [weeping angel](/wiki/Weeping_angel "Weeping angel")

- A [weeping archangel](/wiki/Weeping_archangel "Weeping archangel")

- P [tapioca pudding](/index.php?title=Tapioca_pudding\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Tapioca pudding (page does not exist)")

- @ [watch leader](/index.php?title=Watch_leader\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Watch leader (page does not exist)")

- Quest nemeses:

  - & [Jaquio](/index.php?title=Jaquio\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Jaquio (page does not exist)")
  - @ [Student Leader](/index.php?title=Student_Leader\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Student Leader (page does not exist)")
  - @ [Sir Lorimar](/wiki/Sir_Lorimar "Sir Lorimar") (no longer deferred)
  - @ [The Champion of Pompeji](/index.php?title=The_Champion_of_Pompeji\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "The Champion of Pompeji (page does not exist)")
  - @ [Archnemesis](/wiki/Archnemesis "Archnemesis")
  - D [Alduin](/index.php?title=Alduin\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Alduin (page does not exist)")

- [Deferred and defunct monsters](/wiki/Deferred_and_defunct_features_\(SlashTHEM\) "Deferred and defunct features (SlashTHEM)"):

  - T [Tara Gilesbie](/wiki/Tara_Gilesbie "Tara Gilesbie")
  - @ [Master Sabrina](/wiki/Master_Sabrina "Master Sabrina")
  - @ [Master Brain](/wiki/Master_Brain "Master Brain")
  - B [Ho-Oh](/wiki/Ho-Oh "Ho-Oh")

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/zap.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 3671](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/zap.c#L3671): *monster qualities that confer immunity to death rays*
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/zap.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 4156](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/zap.c#L4156): *Death is empowered by death magic*
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/zap.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 2449](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/zap.c#L2449): *zapping self with death while in nonliving/demon form*
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [src/zap.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 3841](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/zap.c#L3841): *death rays while in nonliving/demon form*
5. [↑](#cite_ref-5) [src/mcastu.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 380](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mcastu.c#L380)
6. [↑](#cite_ref-6) [src/zap.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 3485](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/zap.c#L3485): *`anitmagic` is checked here, but not when zapping self*
7. [↑](#cite_ref-7) [src/mcastu.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 391](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mcastu.c#L391)

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
html:
Death resistance

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

Death resistance is an "informal" property that appears in NetHack, and protects against most magical sources of instant death.

Contents

  • 1 Description
  • 2 Variants
    • 2.1 SLASH'EM
    • 2.2 dNetHack
    • 2.3 FIQHack
    • 2.4 EvilHack
    • 2.5 SlashTHEM
  • 3 References

Description

Monsters with death resistance are immune to the instant death effect of the touch of death monster spell,rays from a wand of death and rays from the finger of death spell. This property does not have its own flag like other resistances, and is instead governed by various other sections of code tied to those attacks and spells.

If a monster is nonliving, a major demon, a vampire in one of their shapeshifter forms, or has player-style magic resistance (either from possessing a magic missile attack or an extrinsic source of magic resistance), they are unaffected by the above spells and attacks[1] - monsters will not actively use the touch of death or other monster spells against other monsters. Death is not special-cased to resist death magic in this manner, but will instead absorb it and empower itself.[2]

The hero resists death magic if they are polymorphed into a death-resistant monster;[3][4][5] magic resistance will block the effects of the touch of death and death rays zapped at them, but will not block a death ray zapped directly at themselves.[6][7]

Variants

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, death resistance is a "formal" property governed by the MR_DEATH flag in monflag.h - this also applies to SlashTHEM. A monster that has the death resistance property and is hit by a touch of death or a death ray will resist the instant death effects of those attacks, but will still take damage.

This property can be found on various monsters in the dungeon, including some of the more powerful ones. As in NetHack, the hero cannot obtain this specific property as an intrinsic from a corpse or through any external source, but can polymorph into a monster that has the property; death resistance will not protect the hero from a death ray zapped at themselves.

The following SLASH'EM monsters possess death resistance, and are listed in rough order of their appearance in monst.c:

  • g Statue gargoyle
  • all angelic beings except the A couatl and A Aleax
  • F Shrieker
  • H Titan
  • H Minotaur
  • P Gray ooze
  • P Brown pudding
  • P Moldy pudding
  • P Black pudding
  • ' Rope golem
  • ' Leather golem
  • ' Wood golem
  • @ Gypsy
  • @ Black marketeer
  • & Spined devil
  • & Bearded devil
  • & bar-lgura
  • & chasme
  • & babau
  • & nabassu
  • Some quest nemeses:
    • @ Water Mage
    • @ Earth Mage
    • & Maugneshaagar
  • Defunct monsters:
    • @ Transmuter
    • @ Lareth
    • @ Sir Lorimar

dNetHack

In dNetHack, notdNetHack, and notnotdNetHack, the spirit Ose grants a hero that binds her immunity to death effects, including from zapping a wand of death at themselves - the character's steed can gain this immunity if they also have Berith bound.

In addition to the same monsters as NetHack, various other monsters in dNetHack are made immune to death magic, and some are even empowered by it:

  • Metroids: metroid monsters that are hit by death magic will not die and instead divide from absorbing the ray; if you zap a death ray at yourself while in the form of a metroid, you are healed for 3d10 HP.
  • All lawful angels
  • All neutral angels
  • All chaotic angels
  • All Keter Sephiroth
  • All golems except the ford guardian and grove guardian

FIQHack

In FIQHack, death resistance is one of the properties that can be conferred by quaffing or dipping into a potion of wonder.

EvilHack

In EvilHack, magic resistance still prevents the instadeath effects of death rays or death touches, but no longer offers complete protection against them: the target will still take significant damage and have their maximum HP drained. Half spell damage combined with magic resistance can reduce this damage further. The Gauntlets of Purity offer complete protection from death magic while worn.

In addition to the same monsters from NetHack, the following monsters in EvilHack are also immune to death magic:

  • All angelic beings
  • All quest leaders
  • Cerberus
  • Baby and adult celestial dragons
  • Death

SlashTHEM

SlashTHEM also features death resistance as a property, with the same effects as in SLASH'EM.

In addition to the listed SLASH'EM monsters, the following monsters introduced in SlashTHEM have death resistance:

  • A weeping angel
  • A weeping archangel
  • P tapioca pudding
  • @ watch leader
  • Quest nemeses:
    • & Jaquio
    • @ Student Leader
    • @ Sir Lorimar (no longer deferred)
    • @ The Champion of Pompeji
    • @ Archnemesis
    • D Alduin
  • Deferred and defunct monsters:
    • T Tara Gilesbie
    • @ Master Sabrina
    • @ Master Brain
    • B Ho-Oh

References

  1. ↑ src/zap.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 3671: monster qualities that confer immunity to death rays
  2. ↑ src/zap.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 4156: Death is empowered by death magic
  3. ↑ src/zap.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 2449: zapping self with death while in nonliving/demon form
  4. ↑ src/zap.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 3841: death rays while in nonliving/demon form
  5. ↑ src/mcastu.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 380
  6. ↑ src/zap.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 3485: anitmagic is checked here, but not when zapping self
  7. ↑ src/mcastu.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 391
